 14726                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14727                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 14728                                  
 14729                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 14730                                  
 14731                                  struc buffinfo
 14732 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 14733 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 14734 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 14735                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 14736                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 14737 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 14738                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 14739                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 14740                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 14741                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 14742                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 14743                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 14744                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 14745                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 14746 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 14747                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 14748 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 14749 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 14750 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 14751 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 14752 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 14753                                  .size:
 14754                                  endstruc
 14755                                  
 14756                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 14757                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 14758                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 14759                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 14760                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 14761                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 14762                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 14763                                  
 14764                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 14765                                  
 14766                                  
 14767                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 14768                                  
 14769                                  ;Flag byte masks
 14770                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 14771                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 14772                                  ;***
 14773                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 14774                                  ;***
 14775                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 14776                                  
 14777                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 14778                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 14779                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 14780                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 14781                                  
 14782                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 14786                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14787                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 14788                                  
 14789                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 14790                                  
 14791                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 14792                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 14793                                  ;
 14794                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 14795                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 14796                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 14797                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 14798                                  ;
 14799                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 14800                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 14801                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 14802                                  
 14803                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 14804                                  
 14805                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14806                                  
 14807                                  struc	DPB
 14808 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 14809 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 14810 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 14811 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 14812 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 14813 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 14814 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 14815 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 14816 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 14817 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 14818                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 14819 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 14820 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 14821 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 14822 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 14823 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 14824                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 14825 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 14826 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 14827 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 14828                                  .size:
 14829                                  endstruc
 14830                                  
 14831                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 14832                                  
 14833                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 14890                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 14891                                  
 14892                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 14893                                  ;
 14894                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 14895                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 14896                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 14897                                  ;
 14898                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 14899                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 14900                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 14901                                  ;
 14902                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 14903                                  
 14904                                  struc A_BPB
 14905 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 14906 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 14907 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 14908 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 14909 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 14910 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 14911 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 14912 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 14913 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 14914 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 14915 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 14916 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 14917 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 14918 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 14919 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 14920                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 14921                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 14922                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 14923                                  .size:
 14924                                  endstruc
 14925

 15183                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15184                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15185                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15186                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15187                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15188                                  									  
 15189                                  ;*******************************					  
 15190                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15191                                  ;*******************************					  
 15192                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15193                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15194                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15195                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15196                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15197                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15198                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15199                                  ;For all others:							  
 15200                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15201                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15202                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15203                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15204                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15205                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15206                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15207                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15208                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15209                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15210                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15211                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15212                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15213                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15214                                  ;									  
 15215                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15216                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15217                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15218                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15219                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15220                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15221                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15222                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15223                                  ;									  
 15224                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15225                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15226                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15227                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15228                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15229                                  ;									  
 15230                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15231                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15232                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15233                                  ;									  
 15234                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15235                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15236                                  ;									  
 15237                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15238                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15239                                  ;									  
 15240                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15241                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15242                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15243                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15244                                  ;						called. 		  
 15245                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15246                                  ;									  
 15247                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15248                                  ;									  
 15249                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15250                                  ;									  
 15251                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15252                                  ;									  
 15253                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15254                                  ;									  
 15255                                  
 15256                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15257                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15258 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15259 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15260                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15261 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15262 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15263 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15264 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15265                                  endstruc					  
 15266

 15268                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 15269                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 15270                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 15271                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 15272                                  					;;End of Modification

 15374                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15375                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15376                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15377                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15378                                  
 15379                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15380                                  ;
 15381                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15382                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15383                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15384                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15385                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15386                                  ;
 15387                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15388                                  ;
 15389                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15390                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15391                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15392                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15393                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15394                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15395                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15396                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15397                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15398                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15399                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15400                                  
 15401                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15402                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15403                                  
 15404                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15405                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15406 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15407 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15408 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15409 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15410 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15411 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15412                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15413 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15414 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15415 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15416                                  .size:
 15417                                  endstruc
 15418                                  
 15419                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15420                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15421                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15422                                  						; argument
 15423                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15424

 15435                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991)

 15439                                  ; system file table
 15440                                  
 15441                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15442                                  ;
 15443                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15444                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15445                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15446                                  
 15447                                  struc	SF
 15448 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15449 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15450 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15451                                  .size:
 15452                                  endstruc
 15453                                  
 15454                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15455                                  ;
 15456                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15457                                  
 15458                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15459 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15460                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15461 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15462 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15463 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15464                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15465                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15466                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15467                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15468                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15469                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15470                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15471                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15472                                  					;
 15473                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15474                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15475                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15476                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15477                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15478                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15479                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15480                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15481                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15482                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15483                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15484                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15485 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15486                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15487                                  					; points to net device header if
 15488                                  					; remote
 15489 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15490                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *

 15492 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15493 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15494 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15495                                  ;
 15496                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15497                                  ; ID
 15498                                  ;
 15499 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15500 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file

 15789                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 15790                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 15796                                  ; 05/07/2018
 15797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15798                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15799                                  
 15800                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15801                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 15802                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15803                                  
 15804                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 15805                                  ;
 15806                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 15807                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 15808                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 15809                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 15810                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 15811                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 15812                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 15813                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 15814                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 15815                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 15816                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 15817                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 15818                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 15819                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 15820                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 15821                                  ;
 15822                                  
 15823                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 15824                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 15825                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 15826                                  ;
 15827                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 15828                                  ;
 15829                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 15830                                  ;
 15831                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 15832                                  ;
 15833                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 15834                                  ;
 15835                                  
 15836                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 15837                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 15838                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 15839                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 15840                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 15841                                  ;      deeply nested one
 15842                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 15843                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 15844                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 15845                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 15846                                  
 15847                                  		;EVEN
 15848                                  ;align 2
 15849                                  		; 21/10/2022
 15850                                  
 15851 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 15852 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 15853 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 15854 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 15855 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 15856 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 15857                                  
 15858 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 15859 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 15860 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 15861                                  
 15862                                  ;***********************************************************************
 15863                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 15864                                  
 15865                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15866                                  
 15867 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 15868                                  
 15869                                  int02:
 15870                                  
 15871                                  ; *********************************************************************
 15872                                  ;
 15873                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 15874                                  ;
 15875                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 15876                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 15877                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 15878                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 15879                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 15880                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 15881                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 15882                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 15883                                  ;
 15884                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 15885                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 15886                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 15887                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 15888                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 15889                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 15890                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 15891                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 15892                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 15893                                  ;
 15894                                  ; *********************************************************************
 15895                                  
 15896 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 15897 00000017 06                      	push	es
 15898 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 15899 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 15900                                  	; 02/11/2022
 15901 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 15902 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 15903 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 15904                                  
 15905 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 15906                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 15907                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 15908                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 15909                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 15910 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 15911 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 15912                                  special02:

 16145                                  
 16146                                  ;********************************************************************
 16147                                  ;common routines
 16148                                  ;********************************************************************
 16149                                  
 16150                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16151                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16152                                  ; service routine
 16153                                  
 16154                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16155                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16156                                  
 16157                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16158                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16159                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16160                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16161                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16162                                  
 16163                                  do_int_stacks:
 16164 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16165 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16166 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16167 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16168 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16169 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16170                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16171                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16172                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16173 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16174 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16175 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16176                                  
 16177 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16178                                  
 16179                                  found02:
 16180 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16181 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16182                                  
 16183 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16184                                  
 16185 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16186                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16187                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16188                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16189                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16190 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16191 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16192                                  
 16193                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16194                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16195                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16196                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16197                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16198                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16199                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16200                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16201                                  
 16202                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16203 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16204 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16205 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16206 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16207 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16208 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16209 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16210 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16211                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16212                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16213 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16214                                  
 16215 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16216                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16217 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16218                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16219                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16220                                  
 16221 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16222                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16223 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16224                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16225                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16226 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16227 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16228                                  
 16229                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16230                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16231                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16232 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16233 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16234                                  
 16235 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16236 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16237 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16238 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16239 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16240                                  
 16241                                  notfree02:
 16242 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16243 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16244                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16245                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16246                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16247 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16248                                  
 16249                                  findnext02:
 16250 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16251 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16252                                  
 16253                                  foundbad02:
 16254 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16255 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16256 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16257                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16258                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16259                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16260 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16261 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16262                                  
 16263                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16264                                  
 16265                                  ; Common routines
 16266                                  
 16267                                  longpath:
 16268                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16269 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16270                                  lploopp:
 16271                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16272                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16273                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16274 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16275 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16276                                  
 16277 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16278                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16279                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16280                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16281 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16282 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16283 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16284                                  
 16285 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16286 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16287                                  
 16288                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16289                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16290                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16291 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16292                                  inuse:
 16293 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16294 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16295 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16296 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16297                                  found:
 16298 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16299                                  fatal:

 16302 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax

 16304 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds

 17009                                  ; This call to DOSINIT will relocate the DOS data from its present location
 17010                                  ; at the top of memory, to its final location in low memory just above the
 17011                                  ; BIOS data. It will then build important DOS data structures in low 
 17012                                  ; memory following the DOS data. It returns (among many other things) the
 17013                                  ; new starting address of free memory.

 17502                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17503                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17504                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17505                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17506                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17507                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17508                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17509                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17510                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17511                                  ;
 17512                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17513                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17514                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17515                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17516                                  ; been patched.

 17802 000007DD BA[5E34]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 17803                                  
 17804                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 17805                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 17806                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 17807                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 17808                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 17809                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 17810                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 17811                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 17812                                  
 17813                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 17814

 17816 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 17819 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 17820 000007EA CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 17821 000007EC 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 17822

 17826 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 17827                                  
 17828                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 17829                                  
 17830                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 17831                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 17832                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 17833                                  
 17834                                  	; 22/10/2022
 17835                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 17837 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 17838                                  
 17839                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 17840                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 17841                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 17842                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 17843                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 17844                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 17845                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 17846                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 17847                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 17848                                  ;
 17849                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 17850                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 17851                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 17852                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 17853                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 17854                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 17855                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 17856

 18101                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18102                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18103                                  ;
 18104                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18105                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18106                                  ;
 18107                                  ; Inputs : None
 18108                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18109                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18110                                  ;	   free memory.
 18111                                  ;
 18112                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18113                                  ;
 18114                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18115                                  
 18116                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18121 0000085D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18122 0000085F CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 18123                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18124                                  	; ds = cs
 18125                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 18126                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 18127 00000861 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 18128 00000864 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 18129 00000867 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory

 18198                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18199                                  ;
 18200                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18201                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18202                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18203                                  ;
 18204                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18205                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18206                                  ; 
 18207                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18208                                  
 18209                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18210                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)

 18220                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18221                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18222                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18241                                  ;
 18242                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18243                                  ;
 18244                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18245                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18246                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18247                                  ;
 18248                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18249                                  ;
 18250                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18251                                  
 18252                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18253                                  MovDOSHi:
 18254                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18255                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18256                                  	; ds = cs
 18257 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18258 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18259 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18260 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18261                                  
 18262                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18263                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18264                                  
 18265                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18266                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18267                                  	
 18268                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18269 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18270                                  
 18271                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18272                                  	
 18273                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18274                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18275                                  	;xor	di,di
 18276                                  	
 18277                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18278                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18279                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18280                                  	; ds = cs
 18281 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18282 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18283                                  
 18284                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18285                                  ;else
 18286                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18287                                  ;
 18288                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0

 18355                                  ;

 18357                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved

 18615                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 18616                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 18617                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 18618                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 18619                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 18620                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 18621                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 18622                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 18623                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 18624                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 18625                                  ;	  stub will go.
 18626                                  ;
 18627                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 18628                                  
 18629                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18630                                  update_arena:
 18631 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 18632 00000988 57                      	push	di
 18633 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 18634 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 18635                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18636                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 18637                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18638                                  	; ds = cs 
 18639 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 18640 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 18641 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 18642                                  						;  before sysvar
 18643 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 18644                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 18645 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 18646 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 18647 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 18648                                  
 18649                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 18650 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 18651 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 18652 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 18653 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 18654 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18655                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 18656 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 18657                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 18658 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 18659 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 18660                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 18661 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 18662 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 18663                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18664                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 18665 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 18666 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 18667 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 18668 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 18669 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 18670 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 18671                                  ;
 18672                                  ; M012 : END
 18673                                  ;

 18691                                  ;
 18692                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 18693                                  ;
 18694                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 18695                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 18696                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 18697                                  ;
 18698                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 18699                                  ;
 18700                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18701                                  
 18702                                  AllocHMA:
 18703                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 18704                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 18705                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 18706                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 18707                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 18708                                  
 18709                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 18710                                  ;
 18711                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 18712                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 18713                                  ;	push	ax
 18714                                  ;	popf
 18715                                  ;	pushf
 18716                                  ;	pop	ax
 18717                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 18718                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 18719                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 18720                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 18721                                  
 18722                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18723                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 18724                                  
 18725 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 18726                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 18727                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT

 18730 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18731

 18733 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 18734

 18736 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 18737                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 18738                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 18739                                  
 18740 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 18741                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 18742 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 18743                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 18744

 18746 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 18747                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 18748 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 18749 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 18750 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 18751                                  
 18752                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 18753                                  
 18754 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 18755 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 18756                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 18757                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 18758                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 18759 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 18760                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 18761                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18762 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 18763                                  allocHMA_1:

 18769                                  
 18770 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 18771 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 18772

 18774 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 18860                                  
 18861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18862                                  ;
 18863                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 18864                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 18865                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 18866                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 18867                                  ;
 18868                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 18869                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 18870                                  ;
 18871                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18872                                  
 18873                                  StartVDHead:
 18874                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 18875                                  
 18876 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 18877 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 18878 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 18879 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 18880 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 18881                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 18882 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 18883                                  VDiskSig1:
 18884 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 18885                                  
 18886                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 18887                                  
 18888 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 18889                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 18890 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 18891 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 18892 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 18893                                  VDInt19:
 18894 00000A75 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 18895                                  OldVDInt19:
 18896 00000A76 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 18897                                  
 18898                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 18899                                  
 18900                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 18901 00000A7A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 18902                                  VDiskSig2:
 18903 00000A7D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 18904                                  
 18905                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 18906                                  
 18907 00000A82 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 18908 00000A85 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 18909 00000A87 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 18910 00000A88 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 18911 00000A8A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 18912 00000A8B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 18913 00000A8D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 18914 00000A8F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 18915 00000A90 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 18916 00000A92 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 18917 00000A94 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 18918 00000A96 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 18919 00000A98 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 18920                                  
 18921                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 18922                                  
 18923                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18924                                  ;
 18925                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 18926                                  ;
 18927                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 18928                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 18929                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 18930                                  ;
 18931                                  ; Inputs : None
 18932                                  ;
 18933                                  ; Outputs : None
 18934                                  ;
 18935                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 18936                                  ;
 18937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18938                                  
 18939                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18940                                  
 18941                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 18942 00000A9A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 18943 00000A9C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 18944                                  
 18945                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 18946                                  
 18947                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18948 00000A9E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 18949                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 18950 00000AA1 2EA3[760A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 18951 00000AA5 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 18952                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 18953 00000AA8 2EA3[780A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 18954                                  
 18955                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 18956                                  
 18957 00000AAC B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory

 19059                                  
 19060                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19061                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19062                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19063                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19064                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19065                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19066                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19067                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19068                                  ;								      ;I070
 19069                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19070                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19071                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19072                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19073                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19074                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19075                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19076                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19077                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19078                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19079                                  ;								      ;I070
 19080                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19081                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19082                                  
 19083                                  	; 12/12/2022

 19121                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19122                                  ;
 19123                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19124                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19125                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19126                                  ;		the offset.
 19127                                  ;
 19128                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19129                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19130                                  ;
 19131                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19136 00000B71 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19137 00000B73 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19138 00000B76 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19139 00000B79 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19140 00000B7B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19141 00000B7D 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19142 00000B7F 1E                      	push	ds
 19143                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19144                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19145                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19146 00000B80 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19147 00000B83 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19148 00000B85 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19149 00000B89 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19150 00000B8E 1F                      	pop	ds
 19151 00000B8F C3                      	retn

 20079                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20080                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20081                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20082                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20083                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20084                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20085                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20086                                  ;
 20087                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20088                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20089                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20090                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20091                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20092                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20093                                  ;
 20094                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20095                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20096                                  ;
 20097                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20098                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20099                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20100                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20101                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20102                                  ;
 20103                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20104                                  ;
 20105                                  ;			  none.
 20106                                  
 20107                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20108                                  ;
 20109                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20110                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20111                                  
 20112                                  	; 24/10/2022
