 20288 00001025 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 20289 00001026 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 20290 00001028 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 20291                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 20292                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 20293                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 20294 0000102A BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20295 0000102D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20296 0000102F CD21                    	int	21h
 20297 00001031 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20298 00001033 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 20299                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 20300                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 20301 00001035 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 20302                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 20303 00001038 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 20304 0000103C B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 20305 0000103E CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 20306                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 20307                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 20308                                  endfile_ret:
 20309 00001040 C3                      	retn

 20311                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.

 20313                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20314                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20315                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20316                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20317                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20318                                  ;
 20319                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20320                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20321                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20322                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20323                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20324                                  ; program).
 20325                                  
 20326                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20327                                  
 20328                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20329                                  
 20330 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20331                                  
 20332                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20333                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20334                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20335                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20336                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20337                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20338                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20339                                  ; carridge return.
 20340                                  
 20341                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20342                                  ;character after =.
 20343                                  
 20344 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20345 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20346 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20347 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20348 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20349                                  
 20350 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20351 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20352 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20353 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20354                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20355 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20356 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20357 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20358 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20359                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20360 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20361 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20362 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20363 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20364 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20365 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20366 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20367                                  done_installparm:
 20368 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20369 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20370 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20371 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20372                                  					; starts with cr.
 20373                                  install_seg_set:
 20374 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20375 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 20376                                  
 20377                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 20378                                  ;
 20379                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 20380                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 20381                                  ;
 20382                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 20383                                  ;
 20384                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 20385                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 20386                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 20387                                  ;
 20388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20389                                  
 20390                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 20391                                  
 20392                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 20393

 20395                                          ;mov     cx,ax

 20397                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 20398                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 20399                                  ;no_envdata2:
 20400                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 20401                                  
 20402                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 20403                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20404                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 20405                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20406 00001081 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 20407                                  
 20408                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 20409 00001085 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 20410                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20411 00001089 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20412                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20413 0000108D 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20414 00001091 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 20415 00001094 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 20416 00001098 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20417 0000109A B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 20418 0000109C BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 20419 0000109F 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 20420 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20421 000010A1 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20422                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20423                                  
 20424                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20425                                  
 20426                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20427                                  
 20428                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20429                                  
 20430                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20431 000010A6 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20432 000010A7 06                      	push	es
 20433 000010A8 1E                      	push	ds
 20434 000010A9 07                      	pop	es
 20435 000010AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20436 000010AB 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20437                                  
 20438 000010AD 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 20439 000010AE E8AF22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20440 000010B1 5E                      	pop	si
 20441                                  
 20442                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20443                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 20444                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20445                                  	; ds = cs
 20446 000010B2 C3                      	retn
 20447                                  
 20448                                  install_exit_ret:
 20449                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 20450                                  
 20451                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20452                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20453 000010B3 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 20454 000010B5 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 20455 000010B7 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20456 000010BA 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20457 000010BC E89316                  	call    error_line
 20458 000010BF F9                      	stc
 20459                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20460 000010C0 C3                      	retn

 20462                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20463                                  
 20464                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20465                                  ;
 20466                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20467                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20468                                  ;
 20469                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20470                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20471                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20472                                  
 20473                                  ParaRound:
 20474 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20475 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20476 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20477 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20478 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20479 000010CC C3                      	retn

 20481                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20482                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20483                                  ;
 20484                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20485                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20486                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20487                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20488                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20489                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20490                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20491                                  ;
 20492                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20493                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20494                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20495                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20496                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20497                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20498                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20499                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20500                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20501                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20502                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20503                                  ;
 20504                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20505                                  
 20506                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20507                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20508                                  sysinit_base:				
 20509 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20510 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20511 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20512 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20513 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20514 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20515 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20516 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20517                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20518                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20519 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20520 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20521 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20522                                  
 20523                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20524                                  
 20525 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20526 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 20527 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20528 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20529 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20530                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20531                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20532                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20533                                  _stall: 
 20534                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20535 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 20536                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20537                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20538 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20539                                  
 20540                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20541 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20542                                  
 20543                                  ;-------------------------------------
 20544                                  
 20545                                  sum_up:
 20546                                  
 20547                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 20548                                  ;out:  ax - result
 20549                                  ;
 20550                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 20551                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 20552                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 20553                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 20554                                  ;
 20555                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 20556                                  
 20557 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 20558                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 20559                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20560 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 20561 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20562 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 20563 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20564 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 20565                                  					;whole test better fail.
 20566 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 20567 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 20568                                  sum1:
 20569 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 20570 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 20571 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 20572 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 20573                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 20574                                  sum_sys_code:
 20575                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20576 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20577                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 20578                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 20579                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 20580                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20581                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 20582                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 20583                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 20584 0000111F B9[F038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 20585 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 20586 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 20587                                  sum2:
 20588 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 20589 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 20590 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 20591 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 20592 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 20593 0000112E C3                      	retn
 20594                                  
 20595                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20596                                  
 20597                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 20598                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 20599 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 20600                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 20601                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:

 20616                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20617                                  ; Set_Buffer
 20618                                  ;
 20619                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 20620                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 20621                                  ;
 20622                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 20623                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 20624                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 20625                                  ;
 20626                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 20627                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.

 20633                                  set_buffer:

 20650

 20689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20690                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 20691                                  ;
 20692                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 20693                                  ;
 20694                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 20695                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 20696                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20697                                  
 20698                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 20699                                  GetBufferAddr:
 20700 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 20701 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 20702 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 20703 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 20704                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 20705 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 20706                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20707                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 20708                                  	; 12/12/2022

 20710 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 20711 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 20715 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 20716 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 20717                                  	;zf=1
 20718                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 20719                                  	;zf=1

 20721                                  got_hma:

 20723 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx

 20728                                  set_buffer_info:
 20729                                  
 20730                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 20731                                  ;
 20732                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 20733                                  ;    ax = di
 20734                                  ;
 20735                                  ;out:
 20736                                  ;    above entries set.
 20737                                  
 20738                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 20739 000011CF 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 20740                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 20741 000011D4 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 20742 000011D8 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 20743 000011DC 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 20744                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 20745 000011E1 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 20746                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 20747 000011E4 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 20748                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 20749 000011EA 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 20750                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 20751 000011F0 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 20752 000011F6 C3                      	retn
 20753                                  
 20754                                  ; ======================================================================
 20755                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 20756                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20757                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20758                                  
 20759                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20760                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 20761                                  ;
 20762                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 20763                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 20764                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 20765                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 20766                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 20767                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 20768                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 20769                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 20770                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 20771                                  ;
 20772                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 20773                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 20774                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 20775                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 20776                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 20777                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 20778                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 20779                                  ;	conditions:
 20780                                  ;
 20781                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 20782                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 20783                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 20784                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 20785                                  ;
 20786                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 20787                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 20788                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 20789                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 20790                                  ;
 20791                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 20792                                  ;
 20793                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 20794                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 20795                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 20796                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 20797                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 20798                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 20799                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 20800                                  ;	interrupt line.
 20801                                  ;
 20802                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 20803                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 20804                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 20805                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 20806                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 20807                                  ;
 20808                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 20809                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 20810                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 20811                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 20812                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 20813                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 20814                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 20815                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 20816                                  ;
 20817                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 20818                                  
 20819                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20820                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 20821                                  
 20822                                  	; 14/12/2022
 20823                                  stackinit:
 20824 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 20825 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 20826 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 20827 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 20828 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 20829 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 20830 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 20831 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 20832 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 20833                                  
 20834                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 20835                                  
 20836                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20837                                  	; ds = cs
 20838 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 20839 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 20840                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20841                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 20842                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 20843 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 20844                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 20845 00001209 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 20846 0000120C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 20847                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20848 00001210 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 20849                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20850                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 20851                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 20852 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 20853                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20854 00001217 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 20855 00001219 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 20856                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20857                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 20858                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 20859 0000121C 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 20860                                  
 20861                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 20862                                  
 20863                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 20864                                  
 20865                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 20866                                  	; 12/12/2022

 20869

 20871                                  
 20872 00001225 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 20873                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 20874                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20875                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 20876 00001228 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 20877 0000122A 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 20878 0000122C 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 20879 00001230 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 20880 00001232 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 20881                                  
 20882                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 20883                                  
 20884 00001235 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 20885 0000123A 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 20886 0000123E F7E1                    	mul	cx
 20887 00001240 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 20888 00001242 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20889 00001244 06                      	push	es
 20890 00001245 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 20891                                  
 20892                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 20893                                  
 20894 00001246 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 20895 0000124A FC                      	cld
 20896 0000124B F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 20897                                  
 20898 0000124D 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 20899                                  
 20900                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 20901                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 20902                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 20903                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 20904                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 20906                                  buildloop:

 21654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21655                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21656                                  
 21657                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21658                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 21659                                  
 21660                                  new_init_loop:
 21661                                  
 21662                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 21663                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 21664                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 21665                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 21666                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 21667                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 21668                                  
 21669 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 21670 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 21671 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 21672 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 21673                                  
 21674 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21675                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 21676                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 21677                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21678 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21679 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 21680 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 21681 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 21682 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 21683 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 21684 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 21685                                  
 21686 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 21687 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 21688 00001412 C3                      	retn
 21689                                  
 21690                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 21691                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21692                                  
 21693                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21694                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 21695                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 21696                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 21697                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 21698                                  ;out: devmark established.
 21699                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 21700                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 21701                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21702                                  
 21703                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21704                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 21705                                  
 21706                                  setdevmark:
 21707                                  
 21708 00001413 06                      	push	es
 21709 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 21710                                  
 21711 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 21712 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 21713 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21714                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21715                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 21716 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 21717 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 21718                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 21719 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 21720                                  
 21721 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 21722 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 21723 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 21724 00001432 C3                      	retn
 21725

 21925                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 21926                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 21927                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 21928                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 21929                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 21930                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 21931                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 21932                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 21967                                  
 21968                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21969                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 21970                                  ;
 21971                                  ;
 21972                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 21973                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 21974                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 21975                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 21976                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 21977                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21978                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21979                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21980                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21981                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21982                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 21983                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 21984                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 21985                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 21986                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 21987                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 21988                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 21989                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 21990                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 21991                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 21992                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 21993                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 21994                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 21995                                  ;	   :
 21996                                  ;
 21997                                  ;Note:
 21998                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 21999                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22000                                  ;
 22001                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22002                                  ;
 22003                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22004                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22005                                  ;
 22006                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22007                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22008                                  ;
 22009                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22010                                  ;
 22011                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22012                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22013                                  ;
 22014                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22015                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22016                                  ;
 22017                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22018                                  ;
 22019                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22020                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22021                                  ;
 22022                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22023                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22024                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22025                                  ;
 22026                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22027                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22028                                  ;
 22029                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22030                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22031                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22032                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22033                                  
 22034                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22035                                  
 22036                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22037                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22038                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22039                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22040                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22041                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22042                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22043                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22044                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22045                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22046                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22047                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22048                                  
 22049                                  ;**** Function flags
 22050                                  
 22051                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22052                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22053                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22054                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22055                                  
 22056                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22057                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22058 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22059 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22060 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22061 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22062 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22063 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22064                                  endstruc
 22065                                  
 22066                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22067                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22068                                  ;
 22069                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22070                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22071                                  ;	     +-
 22072                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22073                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22074                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22075                                  ;	     |	:
 22076                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22077                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22078                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22079                                  ;	     |	:
 22080                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22081                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22082                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22083                                  ;	     +-	:
 22084                                  ;
 22085                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22086                                  ;
 22087                                  ;Note:
 22088                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22089                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22090                                  ;
 22091                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22092                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22093                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22094                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22095                                  
 22096                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22097                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22098                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22099                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22100                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22101                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22102                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22103                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22104                                  
 22105                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22106 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22107 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22108 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22109 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22110 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22111                                  endstruc
 22112                                  
 22113                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22114                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22115                                  ;
 22116                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22117                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22118                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22119                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22120                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22121                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22122                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22123                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22124                                  ;
 22125                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22126                                  ;
 22127                                  ;            +-
 22128                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22129                                  ;	    | or
 22130                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22131                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22132                                  ;	    | or
 22133                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22134                                  ;	    | or
 22135                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22136                                  ;	    | or
 22137                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22138                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22139                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22140                                  ;	    | or
 22141                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22142                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22143                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22144                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22145                                  ;	    +-
 22146                                  ;
 22147                                  ;
 22148                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22149                                  ;      list.
 22150                                  ;
 22151                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22152                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22153                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22154                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22155                                  
 22156                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22157                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22158 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22159 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22160 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22161 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22162                                  endstruc

 22273                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 22277                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22278                                  ; SysParse;
 22279                                  ;
 22280                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22281                                  ;
 22282                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22283                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22284                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22285                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22288                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22289                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22290                                  ;
 22291                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22292                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22293                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22294                                  ;
 22295                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22296                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22297                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22298                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22299                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22300                                  ;
 22301                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22302                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22303                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22304                                  ;
 22305                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22306                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22307                                  ;
 22308                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22309                                  ;
 22310                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22311                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22312                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22313                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22314                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22315                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22316                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22317                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22318                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22319                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22320                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22321                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22322                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22323                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22324                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22325                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22326                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22327                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22328                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22329                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22330                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22331                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22332                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22333                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22334                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22335                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22336                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22337                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22338                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22339                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22340                                  
 22341                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22342                                  
 22343                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22344                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22345                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22346                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22347                                  
 22348                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22349                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22350                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22351                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22352                                  ;
 22353                                  
 22354                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22355                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22356                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22357                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22358                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22359                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22360                                  
 22361                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22362                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22363                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22364                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22365                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22366                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22367                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22368                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22369                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22370                                  
 22371                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22372                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22373                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22374                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22375                                  ;	     segment.
 22376                                  
 22377                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22378                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22379                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22380                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22381                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22382                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22383                                  
 22384                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22385                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22386                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 22388

 22398                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22399                                  
 22400                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two

 22902                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22903                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 22904                                  ;
 22905                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 22906                                  ;
 22907                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 22908                                  ;	    AL = type
 22909                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 22910                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 22911                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 22912                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 22913                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 22914                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 22915                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 22916                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 22917                                  ;
 22918                                  ; Output:   None
 22919                                  ;
 22920                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 22921                                  ;
 22922                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 22923                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22924                                  
 22925                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 22926 0000171F 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 22931 0000172C 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 22932 00001730 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 22933 00001731 2EA1[5014]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 22934 00001735 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 22935                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 22936 00001739 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 22937                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 22938 0000173A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 22939 0000173C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 22940                                  
 22941                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;
 22942 0000173E 26895504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dx ;AN000; then store 32bit
 22943 00001742 26894D06                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val+2],cx ;AN000; number
 22944 00001746 EB5A                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;

 23292                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23293                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23294                                  ;
 23295                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23296                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23297                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23298                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23299                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23300                                  ;
 23301                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23302                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23303                                  ;
 23304                                  ; Output:    None
 23305                                  ;
 23306                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23307                                  ;
 23308                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23309                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23310                                  
 23311                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23312                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23313                                  
 23314                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23315 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23316 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23317 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23318 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23319 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23320 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23321                                  
 23322 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23323 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23324                                  
 23325 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23326                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23327 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23328                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23329 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23330 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23331 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23332                                  
 23333                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23334                                  
 23335                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23336                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 23337 000018FF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23338 00001900 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23339 00001901 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23340 00001902 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23341 00001903 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 23342 00001905 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23343 00001907 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23344                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23345 00001908 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23346 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 23347 0000190D 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 23348                                  
 23349 0000190F E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 23350 00001912 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 23351                                  
 23352 00001914 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;

 23526                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23527                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 23528                                  ;
 23529                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 23530                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 23531                                  ;
 23532                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 23533                                  ;
 23534                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 23535                                  ;
 23536                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 23537                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23538                                  
 23539                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23540                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 23541 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 23542 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 23543 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 23544                                  
 23545 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 23546 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 23547                                  
 23548                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 23549 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 23550 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 23551                                  
 23552 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 23553 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 23554                                  
 23555                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 23556 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 23557 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
