 24109 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24110                                  
 24111                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24112 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24113 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24114                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24115                                  
 24116 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24117                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24118 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24119                                  
 24120 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24121 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24122                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24123 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24124 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24125 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24126                                  
 24127                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24128 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24129 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24130                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24131 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24132 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24133 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24134                                  
 24135 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24136                                  
 24137                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24138 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24139                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24140 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24141 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24142 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24143                                  
 24144                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24145                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24146                                  ;
 24147                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24148                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24149                                  ;	    blanks.
 24150                                  ;
 24151                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24152                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24153                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24154                                  ;
 24155                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24156                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24157                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24158                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24159                                  
 24160                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24161 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24162 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24163 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24164                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24165                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24166 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24167 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24168 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24169                                  
 24170 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24171 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24172                                  
 24173 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24174 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24175                                  
 24176                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24177                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24178 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24179 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24180                                  
 24181 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24182 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24183                                  
 24184 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24185 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24186 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24187 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24188                                  
 24189                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24190 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24191                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24192 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24193                                  
 24194                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24195 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24196                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24197 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24198                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24199 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24200 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24201                                  
 24202 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24203                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24204 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24205 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24206 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24207                                  
 24208 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24209                                  
 24210                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24211 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24212                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24213                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24214 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24215 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24216 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24217                                  
 24218                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24219 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24220 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24221 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24222                                  
 24223 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24224                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24225                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24226 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24227 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 24230                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24231                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24232                                  ;
 24233                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24234                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24235                                  ;
 24236                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24237                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24238                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24239                                  ;
 24240                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24241                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24242                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24243                                  
 24244                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24245                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24246                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24247                                  ;
 24248                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24249                                  
 24250                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24251                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24252                                  
 24253                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24254                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24255 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24256                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24257 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24258 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24259                                  
 24260                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24261 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24262 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24263                                  
 24264 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24265                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24266                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24267 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24268                                  
 24269                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24270                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24271                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24272                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24273                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24274                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24275                                  
 24276                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24277                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24278 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24279 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24280                                  
 24281 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24282                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24283                                  
 24284                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24285                                  	; cf=0
 24286                                  	;retn
 24287                                  
 24288                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24289                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24290                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24291 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24292                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24293                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24294 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24295                                  
 24296                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24297                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24298                                  ;
 24299                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24300                                  ;
 24301                                  ;  Input:
 24302                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24303                                  ;
 24304                                  ;  Output:
 24305                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24306                                  ;
 24307                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24308                                  ;
 24309                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24310                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24311                                  
 24312                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24313 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24314 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24315 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24316                                  	
 24317 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24318 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24319                                  
 24320 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24321 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24322 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24323 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24324 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24325 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24326 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24327 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24328 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24329 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24330 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24331                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24332 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24333 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24334 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24335 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24336 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24337 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24338 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24339 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24340 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24341 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24342                                  
 24343                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24344 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24345 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24346                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24347 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24348 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24349                                  
 24350                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24351 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24352 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24353                                  
 24354 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24355 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24356                                  
 24357 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24358 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24359                                  
 24360 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24361 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24362                                  
 24363                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24364 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24365 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24366                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24367 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24368                                  
 24369                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24370                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24371                                  	; cf=0
 24372                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24373                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24374 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24375 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24376 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24377 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24929                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 24930                                  
 24931                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 24932                                  
 24933                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24934                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24935                                  
 24936                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 24937                                  ;
 24938                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 24939                                  ;
 24940                                  ;******************************************************************************
 24941                                  ;
 24942                                  ;   Modification log:
 24943                                  ;
 24944                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 24945                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 24946                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 24947                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 24948                                  ;
 24949                                  ;******************************************************************************
 24950                                  ;
 24951                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 24952                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 24953                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 24954                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 24955                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 24956                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 24957                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 24958                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 24959                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 24960                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 24961                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 24962                                  ;
 24963                                  ;******************************************************************************
 24964                                  
 24965                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 24966                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 24967                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 24968                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 24969                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 24970                                  
 24971                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 24972                                  
 24973                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 24974                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 24975                                  
 24976                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 24977                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 24978                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 24979                                  
 24980                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 24981                                  ;
 24982                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 24983                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 24984                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 24985                                  ;	           line.
 24986                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 24987                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 24988                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 24989                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 24990                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 24991                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 24992                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 24993                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 24994                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 24995                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 24996                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 24997                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 24998                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 24999                                  ;	           for details).
 25000                                  
 25001                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25002                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25003                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25004                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25005                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25006                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25007                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25008                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25009                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25010                                  
 25011                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25012                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25013                                  
 25014                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25015                                  
 25016                                  %endif
 25017

 25028 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25029 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25030 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25031 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25032 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25033                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25034                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25035                                  ;
 25036 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25037 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25038 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25039 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25040                                  ;
 25041 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25042                                  ;
 25043 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25044 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25045                                  ;
 25046 00001F07 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25047                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25048 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25049                                  ;
 25050 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25051 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25052 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25053                                  ;
 25054 00001F15 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25055 00001F16 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 25056 00001F18 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 25057 00001F1C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25058                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 25059                                  ;

 25072                                  ;
 25073                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25074                                  ;
 25075                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the

 25081                                  doconf:

 25083 00001F1E 1F                      	pop	ds
 25084                                  
 25085 00001F1F B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25086                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25087 00001F22 CD21                    	int	21h
 25088 00001F24 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25089

 25093                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25094                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 25099 00001F2E F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24

 25101 00001F31 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25102                                  
 25103                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25104                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25105                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25106                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25107                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25108 00001F33 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25109 00001F38 C3                      	retn
 25110                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25111 00001F39 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25112 00001F3B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25113 00001F3D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25114                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25115 00001F3F B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25116 00001F42 CD21                    	int	21h
 25117 00001F44 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25118                                  
 25119 00001F47 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25120                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25121 00001F49 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25122 00001F4C CD21                    	int	21h
 25123                                  
 25124                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25125                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25126 00001F4E 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25127                                  
 25128 00001F52 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25129 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25130 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25131 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25132                                  
 25133                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25134                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25135                                  ;;
 25136                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25137                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25138                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25139                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25140                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25141                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25142                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25143                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25144                                  ;;
 25145                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25146                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25147                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25148                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25149                                  
 25150 00001F5D 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25151                                  	
 25152                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25153                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25154                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25155 00001F60 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25156 00001F64 E870EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25157                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25158                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25159 00001F67 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25160                                   
 25161 00001F6C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25162 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25163                                  
 25164 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25165 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25166 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25167                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25168 00001F79 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25169 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25170 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25171                                  
 25172                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25173                                  
 25174 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25175 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25176 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25177 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25178 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25179 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25180 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25181 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25182                                  
 25183                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25184                                  
 25185 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25186                                  
 25187                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25188                                  
 25189                                  puteol:
 25190 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25191 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25192 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25193 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25194 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25195                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25196                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25197                                  
 25198                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25199                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25200 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25201 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25202                                  
 25203 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25204                                  
 25205 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25206 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25207 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25208                                  
 25209                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25210                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25211                                  	;push	cs
 25212                                  	;pop	ds
 25213                                  
 25214 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25215                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25216 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25217 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25218 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25219 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25220 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25221 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25222 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25223                                  conferr:
 25224 00001FA9 BA[0534]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25225 00001FAC E8AD13                  	call	badfil
 25226                                  endconv:
 25227 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25228                                  
 25229                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25230                                  ;
 25231                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25232                                  ;
 25233                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25234                                  ;
 25235                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25236                                  
 25237                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25238                                  multi_pass:
 25239 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25240 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25241                                  
 25242 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25243                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25244 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25245                                  
 25246                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25247                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25248 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25249 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25250                                  
 25251 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25252 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25253 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25254 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25255 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25256                                  
 25257 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25258 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25259                                  
 25260                                  getcom:
 25261 00001FD5 E8B20E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25262 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25263                                  conflp: 
 25264 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25265                                  
 25266 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25267                                  
 25268 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25269 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25270 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25271 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25272                                  
 25273                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25274                                  %if 0
 25275                                  
 25276                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25277                                  
 25278                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25279                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25280                                  
 25281                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25282                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25283                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25284                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25285                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25286                                  
 25287                                          push    ax                      ;
 25288                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25289                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25290                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25291                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25292                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25293                                          pop     ax
 25294                                  ;
 25295                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25296                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25297                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25298                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25299                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25300                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25301                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25302                                  ;   spot.
 25303                                  ;
 25304                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25305                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25306                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25307                                  ;   retrieved.
 25308                                  ;
 25309                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25310                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25311                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25312                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25313                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25314                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25315                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25316                                  final:                                  ;
 25317                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25318                                  not_final:                              ;
 25319                                  ;endif
 25320                                  
 25321                                  %endif
 25322 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25323 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25324 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25325                                  
 25326 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25327                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25328                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25329 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25330 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25331                                  	
 25332                                  coff:	
 25333                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25334                                  	; ds = cs
 25335                                  	;push	cs
 25336                                  	;pop	ds
 25337 00002000 E89E10                  	call	newline
 25338 00002003 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 25339                                  
 25340                                  blank_line:
 25341 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25342 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 25343                                  
 25344                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25345                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25346                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25347                                  ;coff_p:
 25348                                  	;push	cs
 25349                                  	;pop	ds
 25350                                  
 25351                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25352                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25353                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25354                                  ;install= command.
 25355                                  
 25356                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25357                                  ;install command
 25358                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25359                                  
 25360                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25361                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25362                                  tryi:
 25363 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25364 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25365 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25366                                  not_init_pass:
 25367 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25368                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25369                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25370 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25371                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25372                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25373                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25374                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25375                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25376                                  					; and before install= commands
 25377                                  					; are processed
 25378                                  
 25379 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25380 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25381 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25382                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25383                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25384 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25385                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25386                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25387                                  
 25388                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25389                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25390                                          
 25391 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25392                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25393                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25394 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25395                                  	
 25396                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25397 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25398                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25399 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25400                                  
 25401                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25402                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25403                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25404                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25405                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25406                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25407                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25408                                  
 25409                                  multi_try_i:
 25410 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25411                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25412                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25413 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25414                                  
 25415                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25416                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25417                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25418                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25419                                  ;;endif
 25420                                  
 25421 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25422 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25423                                  
 25424                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25425                                  %if 0
 25426                                  
 25427                                  multi_try_n:
 25428                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25429                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25430                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25431                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25432                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25433                                  ;endif
 25434                                  
 25435                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25436                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25437                                  
 25438                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25439                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25440                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25441                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25442                                  
 25443                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25444                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25445                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25446                                  
 25447                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25448                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25449                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25450                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25451                                  
 25452                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25453                                  	mov	bx,1
 25454                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25455                                  
 25456                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25457                                  
 25458                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25459                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25460                                          int     21h
 25461                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25462                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25463                                          int     21h
 25464                                  
 25465                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25466                                  
 25467                                  %endif
 25468                                  
 25469                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25470 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25471 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25472 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25473 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25474 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25475 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25476                                  
 25477                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 25478 0000204C FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 25479 00002050 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 25480                                  
 25481                                  multi_pass_coff:
 25482                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25483 00002054 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 25484                                  
 25485                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25486                                  ; buffer command
 25487                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25488                                  
 25489                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25490                                  ;									      *

 25492                                  ;									      *

 25495                                  ; output:								      *
 25496                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25497                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *

 25515                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *

 27036                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27037                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27038                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27039                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27040                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27041                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27042                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27043                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27044                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27045                                  
 27046                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27047                                  ;									  *
 27048                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27049                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27050                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27051                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27052                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27053                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27054                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27055                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27056                                  ; input :								  *
 27057                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27058                                  ; output:								  *
 27059                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27060                                  ;									  *
 27061                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27062                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27063                                  ; logic:								  *
 27064                                  ; {									  *
 27065                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27066                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27067                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27068                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27069                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27070                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27071                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27072                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27073                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27074                                  ;	     }								  *
 27075                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27076                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27077                                  ;	};								  *
 27078                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27079                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27080                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27081                                  ; };									  *
 27082                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27083

 27388                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27389                                  ; fcbs command
 27390                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27391                                  
 27392                                  ;************************************************************************
 27393                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 27394                                  ;									*
 27395                                  ; input :								*
 27396                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 27397                                  ; output:								*
 27398                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*
 27399                                  ;									*
 27400                                  ; subroutines to be called:						*
 27401                                  ;	sysinit_parse							*
 27402                                  ; logic:								*
 27403                                  ; {									*
 27404                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*
 27405                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						*
 27406                                  ;	while (end of command line)					*
 27407                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*
 27408                                  ;	  if (no error) then						*
 27409                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = fcbs */		*
 27410                                  ;		   fcbs = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 27411                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = keep */ 	*
 27412                                  ;		   keep = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 27413                                  ;	     }								*
 27414                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						*
 27415                                  ;	     error exit;						*
 27416                                  ;	};								*
 27417                                  ; };									*
 27418                                  ;************************************************************************
 27419                                  
 27420                                  tryx:

 27751                                  sysinit_parse:
 27752                                  
 27753                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27754                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 27755                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 27756                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 27757                                  ;
 27758                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 27759                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 27760                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 27761                                  ;	*** after each call.
 27762                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 27763                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 27764                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 27765                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 27766                                  ;	 procedure.
 27767                                  ;	ax - exit code
 27768                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 27769                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 27770                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 27771                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 28096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28097                                  ;
 28098                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28099                                  ;
 28100                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28101                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28102                                  ;
 28103                                  ;	Output : none
 28104                                  ;
 28105                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28106                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28107                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28108                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28109                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28110                                  ;
 28111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28112                                  
 28113                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28114                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28115                                  	; ds = cs
 28116 000027A4 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28117                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28118                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28119 000027A7 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28120 000027AA 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28121                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28122                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28123                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28124                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28125                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28126                                  	; ds = cs
 28127 000027AC 803E[071F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28128 000027B1 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28129 000027B3 A1[EE1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28130                                  lim_set:
 28131                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28132                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28133                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28134                                  ;limx:
 28135                                  	;retn
 28136                                  	
 28137                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28138                                  
 28139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28140                                  ;
 28141                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28142                                  ;
 28143                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28144                                  ;	Output : none
 28145                                  ;
 28146                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28147                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28148                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28149                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28150                                  ;
 28151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28152                                  
 28153                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28154                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28155 000027B6 1E                      	push	ds
 28156 000027B7 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28157 000027BA 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28158 000027BC 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28159 000027C0 2E891E[0B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28160 000027C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28161 000027C7 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28162 000027C9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28163 000027CC 2EC606[0A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28164 000027D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 28165                                  ;limx:
 28166 000027D3 C3                      	retn
 28167                                  
 28168                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28169                                  ;
 28170                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28171                                  ;
 28172                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28173                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28174                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28175                                  ;
 28176                                  ;	Output : none
 28177                                  ;
 28178                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28179                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28180                                  ;
 28181                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28182                                  
 28183                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28184                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28185                                  	; ds = cs
 28186 000027D4 803E[0A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28187                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28188                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28189                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28190 000027D9 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28191                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28192 000027DB B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28193 000027DE 8826[0A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28194                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28195                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28196 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28197                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28198 000027E3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28199 000027E5 2EA1[0B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28200 000027E9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28201 000027EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28202                                  timx:
 28203 000027ED C3                      	retn
 28204

 28251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28252                                  
 28253                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28254                                  
 28255                                  %if 0
 28256                                  
 28257                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28258                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28259                                  
 28260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28261                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28262                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28263                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28264                                  
 28265                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28266                                  ;
 28267                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28268                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28269                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28270                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28271                                  ;
 28272                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28273                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28274                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28275                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28276                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28277                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28278                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28279                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28280                                  ; available during the load.
 28281                                  ;
 28282                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28283                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28284                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28285                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28286                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28287                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28288                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28289                                  ;
 28290                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28291                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28292                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28293                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28294                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28295                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28296                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28297                                  ;
 28298                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28299                                  
 28300                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28301                                  
 28302                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28303                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28304                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28305                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28306                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28307                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28308                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28309                                  
 28310                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28311                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28312                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28313                                  
 28314                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28315                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28317                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28318                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28319                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28320                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28321                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28322                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28323                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28324                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28325                                  
 28326                                  InitVar:
 28327                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28328                                  	push	ax
 28329                                  	push	cx
 28330                                  	push	di
 28331                                  	push	es
